intro: Calamintha suaveolens, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic, licorice-scented leaves and seeds are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Calamintha suaveolens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
